newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian firms said rejecting port fee hike.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian firms said rejecting port fee hike.

text.p: Indonesian companies have rejected a recent hike in port fees by the transport ministry saying it will increase their costs, the Ekonomi Neraca daily said on Wednesday.

"We as businessmen believe it is important to ask the transport minister to withdraw the ruling. If he does not, it will lead to too a high cost economy," Amirudin Saud, head of the Indonesian Importers Association (GINSI), was quoted as saying.
A spokesman at GINSI was not immediately available for comment on Wednesday.

Transport Minister Haryanto Dhanutirto announced on October 2 a 26 percent increase in the charges at all ports including Tanjung Priok in Jakarta, Tanjung Perak in Surabaya, Belawan in Medan and Makasar in Ujung Pandang.
The shipping industry is vital to Indonesia, which consists of more than 13,000 islands. The government plans to develop its Batam Island port as a transshipment port to rival Singapore.
